alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel; Taos (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 30 at 7:40PM MDT until June 30 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar in... Southeastern Taos County in north central New Mexico... Western Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... Northwestern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 1045 PM MDT. * At 740 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over portions of the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Chacon and Guadalupita on the north side of the scar and San Ignacio. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chacon, Guadalupita, and San Ignacio. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 18. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 8 and 45. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 0 and 14. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 65 near Mile Marker 12...and near Mile Marker 14. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. State Road 121 between Mile Markers 0 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of portions of the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
